Fix Copilot Chat Auth Error | Generated by AI

That error usually means GitHub Copilot Chat couldn‚Äôt find a valid authentication token, so it can‚Äôt talk to the Copilot service. It‚Äôs not a coding bug ‚Äî it‚Äôs an authentication/configuration problem.

Here‚Äôs how to fix it step-by-step depending on where you‚Äôre using Copilot Chat:

1. Make sure you‚Äôre signed in with a Copilot-enabled account

  • In VS Code or JetBrains IDE:

    1. Open the Command Palette (Ctrl+Shift+P / Cmd+Shift+P).
    2. Search for ‚ÄúGitHub: Sign in‚Äù.
    3. Follow the sign-in process (it will open a browser to authorize).
    4. Ensure the account you signed in with has an active GitHub Copilot subscription.

  • In Neovim CLI (copilot.vim or copilot.lua):

    • Run :Copilot sign in and follow the link in your browser.

2. Check that GitHub Copilot Chat is enabled

  • In VS Code:

    • Go to Extensions ‚Üí search for ‚ÄúGitHub Copilot Chat‚Äù ‚Üí make sure it‚Äôs installed and enabled.
    • Settings ‚Üí search ‚ÄúCopilot Chat: Enabled‚Äù ‚Üí turn it on.

3. Refresh the authentication token

Sometimes tokens expire or get lost (especially if you changed network, updated the IDE, or switched accounts).

  • VS Code:

    1. Command Palette ‚Üí ‚ÄúGitHub Copilot: Sign out‚Äù.
    2. Then ‚ÄúGitHub Copilot: Sign in‚Äù again.

  • CLI:

    • Delete the token file (e.g., ~/.config/github-copilot/hosts.json) and re-sign in.

4. Check network / firewall restrictions

  • If you‚Äôre on a corporate VPN or firewall, GitHub Copilot may be blocked from reaching its API.
  • Allow access to github.com, api.githubcopilot.com, and copilot-proxy.githubusercontent.com.

5. Update your IDE and Copilot extensions

  • Outdated versions of VS Code or Copilot extensions sometimes cause this issue.
  • Update both, then restart your IDE.

üí° If you fix the auth but still see errors, GitHub Copilot Chat also requires Copilot Chat feature access ‚Äî some accounts have Copilot for coding but not Chat unless it‚Äôs explicitly enabled in settings.
